name: stages
desc
children.label: description
children.help: Technical Information about stage (Not shared with users)

name: stages
help_text
children.label: help_text
children.help: Information to be shared with users in workflow log

name: stages
is_readonly
children.label: is_readonly
children.help: For system stages like "End / Completed".Read only marked stage do not have associated actors or actions.

name: stages
is_deemed_approved
children.label: Eligible for deem approval
children.help: Deemed Approval assures that a user is not requested to approve something twice in different stages.

name: stages
minimum_allocated_time
children.label: minimum_allocated_time
children.tooltip: This is the minimum time that this workflow stage will apply to your document. This is used for situations when you don't want to reply to clients right away and want at-least X amount of "cool-off" period.

name: stages
maximum_allocated_time
children.label: maximum_allocated_time
children.tooltip: This is time in hours of the maximum time allocated for this workflow stage. After this, the workflow is considered in default and goes through enterprise escalations.

name: stages
is_fixed_start_date
children.label: Has Fixed Planned Start Date
children.tooltip: Checking this box will only allow you to enter this stage on the Fixed Planned Start Date. This is required when you don't want previous stages in the workflow to Activate this stage. An example is when a cohort starts on a fixed date.

name: stages
conditional_rule_id
children.label: conditional_rule_id
children.help: At time of entering stage, this rule will be checked. Stage will be entered only if rule is empty or its result in true stage

name: stages
model_state_id
children.label: model_state_id
children.help: Field permission and validation rules to be applied to form when workflow is in this stage. These rules can be further overridden via stage based field permission and validations.

name: stages
possible_actions
action_id
children.label: action_id
children.help: Actions associated with the stage. the possible action on this stage is intersection of the Stage-Actions and Actor-Actions.

name: Form Script
children.label: Form Script
